summary: This is an email newsletter from Law360 dated January 14, 2020, containing a news summary. One item reports that Harvard Law School professor Lawrence Lessig sued The New York Times for defamation, claiming an article falsely implied he defended taking charitable donations from Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Lawrence Lessig
persons.role: Harvard Law School professor, Plaintiff in defamation lawsuit
persons.context: He is suing The New York Times for defamation, claiming an article falsely implied he defended taking charitable donations from Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Financier, source of controversial charitable donations
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of charitable donations that a New York Times article allegedly implied Lawrence Lessig defended accepting.

connections.description: A New York Times article allegedly implied Lessig defended the notion of taking charitable donations from Epstein, which Lessig is disputing in a lawsuit.

events.title: Lawrence Lessig files defamation lawsuit
events.description: Harvard Law School professor Lawrence Lessig launched a defamation lawsuit against The New York Times in Massachusetts federal court.

keyFacts: Harvard Law School professor Lawrence Lessig sued The New York Times for defamation on January 13, 2020.
Lessig claims a New York Times article falsely implied he defended taking charitable donations from Jeffrey Epstein.
The lawsuit was filed in Massachusetts federal court.
